title: AI vs ML vs DL overview
description: Understand the map: AI ⇨ ML ⇨ Deep Learning, and why it matters.
lessonText: You learn the high-level map: AI is the broader goal, ML is learning from data, and DL is a subset of ML using neural networks. You also learn where rules-based systems fit and why data quality matters.

title: Python basics for AI
description: Variables, loops, conditions — enough to start reading AI code.
lessonText: You practice writing small scripts, control flow, functions, and basic data types. The goal is to become comfortable reading and modifying code used in notebooks and ML projects.

title: Numpy essentials
description: Arrays, shapes, vectorization — the building blocks of ML.
lessonText: You learn arrays, broadcasting, vectorized operations, and why performance matters. You should be able to reshape and manipulate tensors confidently.

title: Pandas for datasets
description: Load, clean, filter, and explore datasets like a pro.
lessonText: You learn DataFrames, selecting/filtering, handling missing values, grouping/aggregations, and preparing features for training.

title: Supervised learning intuition
description: Train/test split, overfitting, metrics — the core training loop.
lessonText: You learn the training loop, generalization, overfitting, and evaluation. You should understand why we split data and how metrics guide improvements.

title: Neural networks basics
description: Perceptron, activation, backprop — why DL works.
lessonText: You learn neurons, layers, activations, and backprop at an intuitive level. You should be able to explain why depth helps and what gradients do.

title: Your first model (end-to-end)
description: From dataset ⇨ features ⇨ training ⇨ evaluation.
lessonText: You follow a full pipeline and learn the practical steps. The objective is not perfection; it is to build a mental template you can reuse.

title: MLOps & tracking progress
description: Versioning, experiment logs, and keeping momentum.
lessonText: You learn how to track experiments, manage datasets, keep notes, and maintain consistency. This app mirrors that habit by tracking watch time and sessions.

title: Python functions & practice problems
description: Write small functions and solve practice problems using loops and functions.
lessonText: Practice defining functions, passing arguments, and returning values. Solve common coding challenges to solidify your understanding of control flow and functions.

title: Lists & dictionaries
description: Learn Python lists, dictionaries, tuples and basic scripts.
lessonText: Understand how to store and access data using Python's fundamental data structures: lists for ordered sequences and dictionaries for key-value pairs.

title: Statistics basics for ML
description: Mean, variance, standard deviation and basic distributions.
lessonText: Grasp core statistical concepts like mean, variance, and distributions, which are fundamental for understanding and evaluating machine learning models.

title: Probability & Bayes rule intuition
description: Conditional probability, Bayes rule, correlation vs causation.
lessonText: Develop an intuitive understanding of probability and how Bayes' theorem allows us to update our beliefs in the light of new evidence, a core concept in ML.

title: Linear algebra for ML
description: Vectors, matrices, dot product and matrix multiplication.
lessonText: Learn the basics of linear algebra, including vectors and matrices, which are essential for representing data and understanding the mechanics of many ML algorithms.

title: Calculus intuition for ML
description: Understand derivatives and gradients for optimization.
lessonText: Gain an intuitive understanding of calculus concepts like derivatives and gradients, which are crucial for optimizing machine learning models.

title: First ML model in scikit-learn
description: Implement linear regression or KNN on a simple dataset.
lessonText: Get hands-on experience by building your first machine learning model using the popular scikit-learn library.

title: Overfitting, underfitting & evaluation metrics
description: Learn accuracy, precision, recall and F1-score.
lessonText: Understand the concepts of overfitting and underfitting, and learn how to evaluate your models using key metrics like accuracy, precision, and recall.

title: Deep learning course session
description: Watch 1–2 lectures on building deep neural networks.
lessonText: Dive into deep learning by watching lectures that cover the fundamentals of building and training deep neural networks.

title: Build a simple neural network
description: Use Keras or PyTorch to train a small network on MNIST or similar dataset.
lessonText: Apply your knowledge by building a simple neural network from scratch using a popular deep learning framework like Keras or PyTorch.

title: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)
description: Understand filters, stride, padding and pooling.
lessonText: Learn the fundamentals of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), including the key concepts of filters, stride, padding, and pooling.

title: Build a simple CNN classifier
description: Train a CNN on an image dataset such as digits or cats vs dogs.
lessonText: Put your CNN knowledge into practice by building and training a simple image classifier on a real-world dataset.

title: RNNs and LSTMs
description: Learn sequence modeling concepts for text and time series.
lessonText: Explore Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs) and Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks, and learn how they are used for sequence modeling tasks.

title: Mini project polish
description: Pick one project and clean code, comments, plots and README.
lessonText: Learn how to polish your machine learning projects by cleaning up your code, adding comments, creating informative plots, and writing a clear README.

title: Transformers & attention (high level)
description: Learn what transformers are and why attention is powerful.
lessonText: Get a high-level overview of the Transformer architecture and the attention mechanism that makes it so powerful.

title: Build a GPT from scratch – theory walkthrough
description: Skim a 'GPT from scratch' video to understand tokenization, attention and training loop.
lessonText: Understand the theory behind building a GPT model from scratch, including tokenization, attention, and the training loop.

title: Play with an open-source LLM
description: Use an LLM (API or local) and test prompts for Q&A and summarisation.
lessonText: Get hands-on experience with a large language model by using an open-source LLM for tasks like question answering and summarization.

title: Learn prompt engineering techniques
description: Role prompting, step-by-step reasoning, few-shot examples, constraints.
lessonText: Learn various prompt engineering techniques, including role prompting, step-by-step reasoning, and few-shot examples, to get better results from large language models.

title: Create your own prompt library
description: Organise prompts for coding, learning, automation and writing.
lessonText: Create your own personal prompt library to organize and reuse effective prompts for various tasks like coding, learning, and writing.

title: Explore AI productivity tools
description: Test multiple AI tools on your daily workflow and compare.
lessonText: Explore and compare various AI productivity tools to see how they can be integrated into your daily workflow to improve efficiency.

title: Review & reflection
description: Write a 1–2 page summary of what you learned and next topics to study.
lessonText: Take time to review and reflect on your learning journey by summarizing what you have learned and identifying what you want to study next.
